conclusion: Determine the time of collision using the v-t graph.
Car A has an initial speed of 25 m/s and stops after 30 seconds; Car B has an initial speed of 15 m/s and stops after 25 seconds.
Calculate deceleration for Car A as -5/6 m/s².
Calculate deceleration for Car B as -3/5 m/s².
Equation of motion for Car A: v_A(t) = 25 - (5/6)t.
Equation of motion for Car B: v_B(t) = 15 - (3/5)t.
Car A's velocity becomes zero at t = 30 s.
Car B's velocity becomes zero at t = 25 s.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A before stopping as 375 m.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B before stopping as 187.5 m.
Collision occurs when velocity lines of Car A and Car B intersect on the graph.
